articles.title: Aspinall HOT TAKE! + Jones vs. Pereira = Biggest HW fight of ALL TIME? | Good Guy / Bad Guy
articles.description: On this episode of Good Guy / Bad Guy‚Ä¶The Bad Guy is doubling down on his now viral comments that Tom Aspinall should have continued fighting after being poked in the eyes by Cyril Gane. But does DC agree with the hot take that ruffled feathers across the MMA community? Then, there‚Äôs a new Women‚Äôs Strawweight Champion of the world and her name is Mackenzie Dern! DC breaks down his heartfelt moment with Dern and her daughter that gave fight fans all the feels. Plus, is she making the right move calling for the likes of Tatiana Suarez or Zhang Weili as her next opponent? And, Jon Jones says he‚Äôs down to fight Alex Pereira at the White House. Find out if the guys believe this could be the biggest Heavyweight title fight in UFC history. articles.title: Gane Gets Another Shot ‚Äî Is Aspinall Still the Heavy Favorite?
articles.description: Start fresh at https://tryfum.com/products/zero-crisp-mint. Over 500,000 people have already made the switch ‚Äî no nicotine, no vapor, no batteries. Just flavor, fidget, and a fresh start. UFC 321's main event ended in controversy as Tom Aspinall's first title defense against Ciryl Gane was halted due to an accidental eye poke. Despite the no-contest outcome, the question remains: Is Aspinall still the favorite in a potential rematch? In this video, Chael Analyzes the fight's dynamics, examining Aspinall's striking power and Gane's defensive skills. We also discuss the psychological impact on both fighters and speculate on how the betting odds might shift for a future bout. Join us as we break down the key moments and what they mean for the heavyweight division. Tom Aspinall, Ciryl Gane, UFC 321, heavyweight title, no contest, eye poke, UFC rematch, betting odds, UFC analysis, UFC news. articles.title: Mackenzie Dern Wins UFC Championship After Being Taken Down 9 Times‚Ä¶
articles.description: üí• Watch as Mackenzie Dern defies the odds and captures the UFC Strawweight Championship ‚Äî even after being taken down nine times! üëë In this video, we break down how Dern turned the tide: absorbing repeated takedowns, capitalizing on her guard game, and unleashing strikes from the bottom to secure the win. Her relentless ‚Äúwant-it‚Äù attitude set her apart. üìå Expect fight highlights, tactical analysis of Dern‚Äôs ground defense and offense, and insights into how she transformed adversity into triumph. #UFC #MackenzieDern #StrawweightChampion #FightAnalysis #MMAHighlights #TakedownDefense #UnderdogVictory Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 All things UFC and MMA with the undefeated Bad Guy, Chael Sonnen. articles.title: Daniel Cormier REACTS to Tom Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane CONTROVERSIAL NO CONTEST, eye poke ends fight
articles.description: Daniel Cormier IS BACK live from Abu Dhabi UFC 321 to give his post-fight reaction to Tom Aspinall vs. Ciryl Gane being ruled a NO CONTEST after an eye poke to Tom! DC weight in on the controversial end to the fight, and what that means for Gane and Aspinall moving forward. Plus, Cormier gives his take on Mackenzie Dern's title fight win in the co-main event. And DC issues an apology to Jailton Almedia following his comments this week to Aspinall. All lines provided by @hardrockbet Follow me on all social media platforms! articles.description: Don‚Äôt miss out on all the action this week at DraftKings! Download the DraftKings app today! Sign-up using https://dkng.co/sonnen or through my promo code SONNEN UFC 321 is almost here, and the heavyweight clash between Tom Aspinall and Ciryl Gane has everyone talking. Chael Sonnen breaks down this high-stakes showdown, explaining why Gane could take Aspinall into ‚Äúdeep water‚Äù with his striking, movement, and fight IQ. From strategy to potential pitfalls, Chael shares his expert prediction on who has the edge, and what this fight means for the future of the UFC heavyweight division.
